intro: Auriculardisia spathulata, commonly known as the broad-leafed auriculardisia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forests or undergrowth. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
